metadata.title: CVE-2017-10378 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Optimizer). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.57 andearlier, 5.6.37 and earlier and 5.7.11 and earlier. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang orfrequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 6.5 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10378` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

mariadb-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.19-0ubuntu1').
mariadb-10.1 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
